alert.note: Alert for Eastern Dutchess; Eastern Ulster; Western Dutchess; Western Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 24 at 10:44PM EST until February 25 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation expected. Total snow and sleet accumulations of 4 to 8 inches and ice accumulations a light glaze to a tenth of an inch. * WHERE...The southeast Catskills, mid Hudson Valley, and the southern Taconics in eastern New York and Litchfield County in northwest Connecticut * WHEN...Until 7 PM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning commute and may impact evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Maximum snowfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour are expected this morning. Snow will change to sleet shortly before or after day break, with a brief period of freezing rain possible late in the morning. Mixed precipitation may change back to snow in the afternoon before tapering to snow showers and flurries in the early evening.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
